Here's how things work:

- **High pickrate + high winrate** = Probably too strong or too rewarding overall

- **Low pickrate + decent/positive winrate** = Only good into a few matchups, unpopular champion, and/or winrate is held up by dedicated mains
- **Low pickrate + low winrate** = Very weak, no strong matchups, any winrate is most likely held up by very dedicated mains

Shields are treated as health, and as such they are given the same resistances that the character's health would if they simply had that much health. 

Pyke's execute ignores resistances if the enemy is below the set amount of health, which includes the shield. As a result, the damage is dealt as true damage instead of physical. 

So if I have 236 remaining HP and Pyke's ultimate deals 450 damage, the full amount of my hp is dealt as true damage. If instead I use Barrier, giving me an additional  215 shield (236 + 215 = 451), Pyke's ultimate deals 450 damage as physical damage, which is reduced by my armor. With 100 armor, physical damage is 50% effective, so Barrier would absorb 215 of that physical damage and my actual health would take 10 damage.

Shields have never been treated as health. They are treated as damage reduction prior to direct HP damage. There's a difference. Shield is more akin to Armor/Resistance than it is Health, because of the order.

I really wonder where people get the crap they spew out online. 

Please do some research on [shields](https://leagueoflegends.fandom.com/wiki/Shield).

I have good news. It won't take long. Just read the first two paragraphs.

Shields can increase a unit's current health over its maximum, _**but they do not count as maximum health.**_ Before receiving damage, shields take into account the unit's resistances (armor or magic resistance). The shield strength can be increased with some items and runes.

In other words........ what I said is true.

The only reason you linked that wiki and think you are right, is simply because of the fact there's really no more appropriate wording to describe what a shield really is.

It isn't Maximum Health.
It isn't Magic Resist/Armor.

It behaves LIKE health.
